title: The Side Effects Of Being Young
description: "I'm sick of hiding behind my books and music. Maybe tonight I'll face myself down. Maybe tonight I'll be brave enough. But then how could I face the morning light? A deeper knowledge of self could change me forever. What am I even running from though?" The leap year poet strikes again! In this, Jone's second book of poetry about life, loss, gain, pleasure, pain, joy, grief, and all that can happen to a person in four years.
author: Elizabeth Grace Jones
